name: Cocktail à la Louisiane
description: First documented 70 years ago in Arthur's Famous New Orleans Drinks and How to Mix 'Em, the Cocktail à la Louisiane has been largely ignored since then. It's worth the effort to search out the ingredients (or a talented bartender in a well-stocked establishment) and bring this drink into the 21st century.
recipeIngredient: 3 to 4 dashes absinthe or a substitute (Herbsaint, Pernod, Ricard, or other pastis)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass. Fill glass with cracked ice and stir for 20-30 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass; garnish with a cherry.
